author: Jeff Piker (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Apaches give Rust 100th coaching victory
text: slideshow LITTLE ROCK — With the homecoming crowd behind them, the Arkansas Baptist Eagles gave the Pottsville Apaches all they wanted in the first half Friday night.But Pottsville pulled away in the second half and earned a 35-14 conference win and high school football win No. 100 for head coach Brian Rust.“It was an ugly win for us. But on the road in conference play, we will definitely take it,” Rust said. “I’m proud of the way our guys came out in the second half.”Pottsville (3-2, 1-1 4A-4 Conference) wasted no time getting on the board in the first half by scoring on their first possession. Jacob Dugger led the Apaches on a 60-yard, seven-play drive that ended with brother Josh going the last 12 for the score. The extra point attempt was blocked and with 8:57 left in the first quarter, Pottsville took a 6-0 lead.The Eagles (0-5, 0-2) were quick to answer with their own 60-yard drive that took less than two minutes. Quarterback Cory McGonigal completed a 20-yard touchdown pass to his younger brother Chad for Baptist preps first score. The Eagles kicked the extra point attempt and took a 7-6 lead over Pottsville. That score would remain for the rest of the first quarter.Pottsville regained with just 42 seconds left in the first half when Jake Dugger found Bryce Prince in the end zone for the touchdown. Josh Dugger ran the ball over the left side for the two-point conversion and Pottsville took a 14-7 lead into halftime.Arkansas Baptist took over on the Pottsville 35 after an Apache fumble. Four plays later, Andre Maloy ran the ball in from 17 yards out for the touchdown. The PAT tied the game 14-14, with 8:10 left in the third quarter.From that point, Pottsville’s offense took over the game. Jake Dugger connected with Austin Bell for a 32-yard touchdown strike that gave the Apaches a 20-14 lead with 1:28 left in the third quarter.With 7:13 left in the fourth quarter Pottsville extended its lead when Austin McNeely went up the middle from 4 yards out. He then added the 2-point conversion and gave the Apaches a 28-14 lead.After holding the Eagles on downs, Pottsville took over on the Baptist 41 and went on a nine-play drive capped when Josh Duggar went across the goal line for the touchdown. Bill Lowe added the PAT that gave the Apaches their 35-14 victory.Austin McNeely led Pottsville’s rushing attack ground game with 154 yards. Josh Dugger chipped in with 64 yards. Jake Dugger finished with 76 yards passing and two touchdowns. Bryce Prince and Austin Bell each caught touchdown passes.“I have been blessed to have some great players and be able to coach with some great coaches. This is a special win,” Rust added.The Apaches will celebrate homecoming Friday when they host Ozark.
